did.abstract: Collection comprises a letter to Charles W. Hare, in Philadelphia, regarding Cobb's land development activities in Maine.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: David Cobb Papers, 1806 June 29, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Revolutionary War soldier and aide-de-camp to General George Washington, speaker of the Massachusetts House of Representatives and president of the Senate, physician, judge, member of Congress, lieutenant governor of Massachusetts, and a founder of the Society of the Cincinnati and the American Academy of Arts and Sciences. At the time of this letter, Cobb was a resident of Gouldsboro, Maine.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises a letter to Charles W. Hare, in Philadelphia, regarding Cobb's land development activities in Maine.
